  2. Ask - Agent - Edit
  3. Edit - Plan

Also it has started hallucinating more in last couple of days, with same code and instruction set I originally have used.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: nightmare, absolutely dead

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Garbage plugin. Scrolling chat window using touchpad on macOS is the ultimately worst out there I've ever seen. How it can be that bad is simply unimaginable to me. Completely freezes the IDE when an agent runs. Terrible UI overall. Changes overlay (buttons to navigate between changes) does not know which IDE has the agent running and haunts you everywhere just in case.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Overall, the plugin is really good. They just have a quality control issue with their releases.

In DataGrip 2025.3.5, I had auto-update turned on, and when the newest version of the Copilot plugin 1.5.65-243 (from 2026/02/12) got installed, the plugin crashed on startup. I turned off auto-update, and downgraded to version 1.5.63-243 (from 2020/01/15) using the "Install from disk" process, and everything is working again.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: All I get is “Oops, you reached the rate limit. Please try again later.” even after paying every single month! This is the level of service you give paying users? Hire some better developers for freaking sake!

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Utterly annoying and broken.

Responses are cut of. The ui is horrible. Incredibly buggy and unstable

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: 1.5.65-243 MacBook M4 Max, macOS Sequoia. Pycharm unpredictable scrolling behavior, UI is jittering heavily.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: I see a lot of negative reviews, so I thought I'd give positive feedback. I use this A LOT. While the VS Code implementation is the best, the JetBrains implementation isn't half bad. I'd wish that updates came out faster. You can wait weeks or months waiting for an update that's already out in VS Code. I'd also love to see more of the deliberations, which as shown in VS Code. And the Rider implementation keeps inserting byte order marks near the top of my files that have to be manually discarded. I've also seen more misfired in Rider, where it for example deletes most of a file and then complains that it's missing. It's OK, and can just cancel it, but that never happens in VS Code. The personality also seems different. Claude Opus 4.5 is more of a clear thinker in VS Code than it is in Rider, where I get more ready-fire-aim. You should tell the model that it's OK to be unsure or need more info. Being overconfident to the point of gaslighting is ChatGPT's job.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: When I click "Copilot Chat" icon, the whole WebStorm application freezes indefinitely. So it's not only useless, but also breaks the editor. Malware, basically. Good job, Microslop!

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Login doesn't work. We got an expensive GitHub Copilot subscription specifically to use this in PHPStorm and the login does nothing. We get a message that authentication worked but the plugin stays stuck on the Sign in for GitHub Copilot page.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Unable to login to a Github Enterprise Account - followed steps on github how to do this and it doesn't save my credentials.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: In agent mode, it stops unexpectedly — I have to prompt it several times to finish generating the files. It’s awful.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: The generated code is incomplete, and the code block cannot copy. After two updates the issues remain. I wonder if the bugs were caused by AI programmer in the plugin dev team.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
It seems like every other release is badly broken.

For now I have turned off the "update plugins automatically" setting and have manually installed (Plugins > Settings > Install Plugin from Disk) an older version that works better.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Works better than in the past. But I still have to press "Continue" all the time just to edit files. Also it always to to run tests with maven instead of using the IntelliJ runner for this which slows down things dramatically. Also, the IDE becomes very slow when the agent is active.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Agent mode is suddenly forced onto users by setting this to default and resetting it back from the selection menu on every startup. At least before, it remembered my selection between IDE restarts. The only way to avoid this by completely disable Agent mode entirely. Feels like an attempt to get users to use more tokens unnecessarily.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: code suggestions are often truncated and incomplete in chat window

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: PyCharm (latest as of 12 Feb 2026) / MacOS Tahoe 26. The Copilot UI is a total mess. Code that it generates in Chat mode gets truncated midway. I have to restart PyCharm to restore the Chat View and be able to see the full code snippet. It's not the model's fault, it's the plugin that cuts off the result in half. Also: Totally erratic and unpredictable scrolling behavior, UI is jittering like crazy.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Compared to VS Code version this plugin is a disaster. Constant issues, agent mode does not work when doing remote dev, models selection dissapears, you need to relogin to fix, do not see files in remote dev, copilot instructions not detected in agent mode, etc. The bugs list goes on and on…

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: I've been fan of Copilot for years, but now it's become unusable and I'm cancelling subscription as I can't see improvement for years. Too buggy, to slow, slopy suggestions (better not to suggest at all). Sorry, but caused issues for so long and broke projects several times, so it deserves lowest score.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Far too buggy. The text truncating issue has come back in the most recent release. Do better Microslop.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: This plugin is completely broken. The text in the chat jumps around while scrolling, it generates way too many .md files, even for simple answers, it shows 'rate limit' errors despite having plenty of tokens left, chat sometimes resets after I send a prompt, causing my prompt to disappear. I’ve switched to VS Code for AI programming.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Hitting constant rate limits on opus models, even with a pro plan. Pretty much useless for anything even slightly more complex than quick code completion

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Everything is broken with this plugin; every next update they make it worse - as of now the response generate by it have incomplete code snippets

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: As of today, Github Copilot only displays suggestions that are interrupted in the middle of the code. The tool is no longer usable.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: The quality of this product is shameful, especially when you compare it to what is available on other IDEs. Every usage is basically a coin toss, it may work perfectly or it may give you a random problem (random responses filtered out, incomplete responses, not enough token problems when you've got plenty, etc.)

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Although good when it works, the unpredictable behavior breaks usability completely. Rate limiting while still having plenty of tokens left interrupts context and produces unstable or completely broken code. Context retainment even in an agent session is dubious, and instructions need to be reiterated multiple times.

But most annoying at all? Agent mode can happily produce 3-4 .md files summarizing and explaining code changes for the simplest of tasks.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: I never have big complained about this plugin, I'm usually using just ask question and ignore other feature, but every new update it keeps breaking stuff and feel worse somehow, and now with the newest update which I regrade upgrade, cut off the answer before the reply is full complete

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Overall, it provides a great experience. I get especially impressive results with the Sonnet and Opus models. Recently, I also integrated my database via MCP, which helped complete my development ecosystem. Kudos to the IntelliJ developers for their great work.

There are occasional rate-limit issues, but I use GitHub Copilot across multiple editors and see the same limitation elsewhere as well. I’m confident this will be resolved in the near future. I will continue using GitHub Copilot with IntelliJ.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: 上次更新之后，回答的内容要么是显示不全，要么是输出不全

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Unfortunately Copilot has become unusable for me. I’m constantly hitting rate limits; roughly every 1–2 prompts even on a Pro plan. I also tried switching to an Enterprise setup for work and saw the same issue. At this point I’m forced to stop using Copilot and pay for another tool, because a paid product that rate-limits after the first couple of prompts isn’t reliable for daily development.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: The edit mode stopped working. When I request to edit some code via chat, there is no response, and sometimes a change appears in the code out of nowhere, without any interaction with the copilot.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: 2 days ago I found out that moving selected code in RIder, simply removes it. Pasting to AI Assistant input box doesn't work via Ctrl+V or context menu. Updated GitHub Copilot, Restarted IDE, Reset cache... Restarted computer. Today fixed by disabling GitHub Copilot.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
While AI isn't "totally there yet", this is certainly good at integrating with Rider and giving the models context to your project. I especially like that I can make a copilot-instructions file to give it some global context.

As far as models it supports quite a bit, including Opus 4.5 which has been the best for my Unreal Engine development as far as making complex systems. Like I said still a bit aways away from truly having the context length required to be a full helper, but I am grading off what it is now and not what it could be in the future.

Only question I have is: Opus 4.6 when?

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Continuously improving integration and regular updates. Major leap forward over the past few months.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: I love it, it was buggy a few months ago now it works very well. I can't work without it now.

comment: I love the Rider IDE, but it's almost impossible to use GitHub Copilot there. It has some annoying bugs, and the most annoying is about MCP Servers. The chat does not recognize my local running MCPs and mcp.json frequently disappears with labels to start and stop the servers.
